animateLipidsDescription.value: Om fosforlipiderne der danner cellemembranen, skal animeres

preferencesDialog.simulation.animateLipi.value: Animación ondulante de la bicapa de fosfolípidos que forma la membrana celular.

preferencesDialog.simulation.glucoseMeta.value: Las moléculas de glucosa se desvanecen dentro de la célula para simular su conversión en el metabolismo celular.

preferencesDialog.audio.sounds.stereoCro.value: Enfatiza la dirección del transporte de solutos asignando el sonido al canal derecho (del exterior al interior) y al izquierdo (del interior al exterior).

keyboardHelp.transportProteinsAndLigands.value: Navegar por proteínas en la caja de herramientas o por ligandos añadidos
Mover la proteína o el ligando tomado entre posiciones disponibles
Cancelar la toma o el movimiento

keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.title.value: Ordenar o eliminar proteínas en la membrana

keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.naviga.value: Navegar por las proteínas en la membrana

keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.moveGr.value: Mover la proteína tomada entre ranuras

keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.releas.value: Soltar la proteína tomada en una ranura vacía o intercambiar ranuras

a11y.simpleDiffusionScreen.screenButtons.value: Explora qué solutos pueden difundirse libremente en un entorno celular.

a11y.facilitatedDiffusionScreen.screenBu.value: Explora condiciones para facilitar la difusión de solutos usando proteínas de transporte.

a11y.activeTransportScreen.screenButtons.value: Explora condiciones para transportar activamente solutos usando proteínas de transporte.

a11y.playgroundScreen.screenButtonsHelpT.value: Juega con todos los solutos y todas las proteínas de transporte.

a11y.screenSummary.playArea.intro.value:
Una ventana de observación hace zoom en una sección transversal muy pequeña de la membrana de una célula.
  La membrana consiste en una bicapa de fosfolípidos ondulante, una lámina de doble capa
  que separa los fluidos dentro y fuera de la célula. Al agregar al exterior o al interior,
  las partículas de soluto quedan suspendidas en el fluido y se mueven aleatoriamente con movimiento browniano.

a11y.screenSummary.playArea.proteins.value: Se pueden agregar directamente a la membrana proteínas de transporte de distintos tipos.

a11y.screenSummary.playArea.potential.value: Hay opciones para cambiar el entorno celular y afectar a las proteínas añadidas.

a11y.screenSummary.playArea.barCharts.value: Las gráficas de barras de concentraciones comparan dinámicamente las cantidades de soluto fuera y dentro de la célula.

a11y.screenSummary.controlArea.value: Puedes pausar la acción o ralentizarla para escuchar más detalles, añadir o quitar sonidos y resaltados que enfatizan los cruces de solutos, y restablecer todo para comenzar de nuevo.

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.leadin.value: Ahora mismo, la sección transversal ampliada de la célula tiene:

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.solute.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } tipo de soluto en el exterior
 *[other] { $count } tipos de soluto en el exterior
}

{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } tipo de soluto en el interior
 *[other] { $count } tipos de soluto en el interior
}

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.transp.value:
{ $proteinCount ->
  [one] { $proteinCount } proteína
  *[other] { $proteinCount } proteínas
} de { $proteinTypeCount ->
  [one] { $proteinTypeCount } tipo
 *[other] { $proteinTypeCount } tipos
}, en la membrana

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.ligand.value: 2 tipos de ligandos añadidos solo en el exterior

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.atpRea.value: ATP reaccionando para formar ADP y fosfato, que regularmente se desvanecen en el interior

a11y.screenSummary.currentDetails.glucos.value: La glucosa desaparece del interior a medida que es metabolizada por la célula

a11y.screenSummary.interactionHint.value: Agrega o quita solutos en el exterior o interior de la célula y observa las concentraciones.

a11y.screenSummary.interactionHintWithTr.value: Agrega o quita solutos en el exterior o interior de la célula, mueve proteínas de transporte a la membrana y observa las concentraciones.

a11y.soluteControls.accessibleHelpText.value: Agrega o quita el soluto elegido en el exterior o interior de la célula.

a11y.eraseSolutesButton.accessibleContex.value: Solutos borrados. Agrega solutos para observar cambios.

a11y.eraseSolutesButton.accessibleHelpTe.value: Deshabilitado cuando no se han añadido solutos.

a11y.settings.crossingHighlightsCheckbox.value: Explora con o sin resaltados visuales para los cruces de solutos.
Resaltados visuales para cruces de solutos, activados.
Resaltados visuales para cruces de solutos, desactivados.

a11y.settings.crossingSoundsCheckbox.acc.value: Explora con o sin sonidos únicos para los cruces de solutos.
Sonidos de cruce de solutos activados.
Sonidos de cruce de solutos desactivados.

a11y.transportProteinToolbox.accessibleH.value: Caja de herramientas de proteínas de transporte
Busca proteínas para tomar. Una vez tomada, usa accesos de teclado para soltarla en una ranura de la membrana. Tómala de nuevo desde la membrana para ordenar o eliminar.

a11y.transportProteinToolbox.ligandGated.value: Tomar Selectiva para sodio, regulada por ligando
Tomar Selectiva para potasio, regulada por ligando
Proteínas transmembrana de un solo canal que pueden estar abiertas o cerradas. Cuando están cerradas, tienen un sitio de unión de ligando con forma de triángulo o estrella.

a11y.transportProteinToolbox.leakageChan.value: Tomar Selectiva para sodio, de fuga
Tomar Selectiva para potasio, de fuga
Proteínas transmembrana de un solo canal, siempre abiertas.

a11y.transportProteinToolbox.voltageGate.value: Tomar Selectiva para sodio, regulada por voltaje
Tomar Selectiva para potasio, regulada por voltaje
Proteínas transmembrana de un solo canal que pueden estar abiertas o cerradas.
Ajusta milivoltios y observa las proteínas.

a11y.chargesCheckbox.accessibleHelpText.value: Explora con o sin signos de carga que muestran el potencial de membrana a lo largo del interior y el exterior.

a11y.chargesCheckbox.voicingHelpText.value: Explora con o sin signos de carga a lo largo de la membrana.

a11y.chargesCheckbox.accessibleContextRe.value: Positivo en el exterior y negativo en el interior; signos de carga densos a lo largo de la membrana.
Positivo en el exterior y negativo en el interior; signos de carga poco densos a lo largo de la membrana.
Negativo en el exterior y positivo en el interior; signos de carga escasos a lo largo de la membrana.
Signos de carga del potencial de membrana, ocultos.

a11y.chargesCheckbox.activeTransportProt.value:
Proteínas que se abren a un lado a la vez. La bomba sodio-potasio, cuando está abierta hacia el interior tiene sitios de unión para 3 
  sodios y 1 fosfato. Cuando está abierta hacia el exterior tiene sitios de unión para 2 potasios. El cotransportador sodio-glucosa, 
  solo se abre hacia el exterior y tiene sitios de unión para 2 sodios y 1 glucosa. Requiere una concentración de sodio exterior más alta para transportar.

a11y.ligandNode.accessibleHelpText.value: Toma un ligando. Una vez tomado, usa accesos de teclado para mover el ligando al sitio de unión. Suelta para unir o deja que los ligandos se unan de forma natural.

a11y.ligandNode.voicingHintResponse.value: Mover a proteína regulada por ligando.

a11y.ligandNode.releasedOnProteinRespons.value: Soltado. Unión exitosa. La proteína se abre.

a11y.ligandNode.releasedOnBusyOrIncompat.value: Soltado. Unión no exitosa. El ligando se aleja flotando.

a11y.ligandNode.unboundResponse.value: El ligando se aleja flotando. La proteína se cierra.

a11y.ligandNode.movedAboveLigandGatedCha.value:
Encima de { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   abierta
*[closed] cerrada
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName } { $proteinType ->
[sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Sitio triángulo
*[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel]     Sitio estrella
}, { $index } de { $transportProteinCount } proteínas.

a11y.ligandNode.movedAboveOtherChannelRe.value:
Encima de { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   abierta
*[closed] cerrada
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName }, { $index } de { $transportProteinCount } proteínas.

a11y.ligandNode.grabbedResponse.value: Tomado. Fuera de la membrana. { $proteinCount } proteínas en la membrana.

a11y.ligandNode.grabbedResponseWithHint.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Mueve el ligando con las teclas A o D. Barra espaciadora para soltar.

a11y.ligandNode.grabbedResponseWithEmpty.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Barra espaciadora para soltar. Agrega proteínas de transporte.

a11y.solutes.amountComparison.value:
{ $amount ->
  *[none]  ninguna
  [equal] cantidades exactamente iguales fuera y dentro
  [allOutside] todo fuera, nada dentro
  [allInside] todo dentro, nada fuera
  [manyManyMoreOutside] muchísimo más fuera que dentro
  [manyMoreOutside] mucho más fuera que dentro
  [aboutTwiceAsManyOutside] aproximadamente el doble fuera que dentro
  [aLotMoreOutside] bastante más fuera que dentro
  [someMoreOutside] algo más fuera que dentro
  [littleBitMoreOutside] un poco más fuera que dentro
  [roughlyEqualOutside] cantidades aproximadamente iguales dentro y fuera
  [manyManyMoreInside] muchísimo más dentro que fuera
  [manyMoreInside] mucho más dentro que fuera
  [aboutTwiceAsManyInside] aproximadamente el doble dentro que fuera
  [aLotMoreInside] bastante más dentro que fuera
  [someMoreInside] algo más dentro que fuera
  [littleBitMoreInside] un poco más dentro que fuera
  [roughlyEqualInside] cantidades aproximadamente iguales dentro y fuera
}

a11y.solutes.averageCrossingDirection.value:
{ $direction ->
  [toOutside] hacia afuera
  [mostlyToOutside] mayormente hacia afuera
  [inBothDirections] en ambas direcciones
  [mostlyToInside] mayormente hacia adentro
  [toInside] hacia adentro
  *[none] ninguno recientemente
}

a11y.solutesPanel.potassiumIonRadioButto.value: Ion de potasio, K, positivo, pequeño

a11y.solutesPanel.accessibleHelpText.value: Elige un soluto para los Ajustadores de solutos.

Observa solutos cruzando. Busca ajustar solutos y proteínas.

a11y.transportProtein.initialGrabbedHint.value: Elige ranura con A o D. Barra espaciadora para soltar. Supr para eliminar.

a11y.transportProtein.offMembraneRespons.value: Encima de la caja de herramientas, fuera de la membrana.

a11y.transportProtein.releasedReplacedRe.value: Soltada en la membrana. Proteína reemplazada.

a11y.transportProtein.cancelledBackToSlo.value: Cancelado. De vuelta en la membrana.

a11y.transportProtein.cancelledBackToToo.value: De vuelta en la caja de herramientas.

a11y.transportProtein.voicingHintRespons.value: Barra espaciadora para tomar o soltar.
Reordenar o quitar de la membrana.

a11y.transportProtein.accessibleObjectRe.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumBound] abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumAndPhosphateBound] abierta hacia el interior
   [openToOutsideAwaitingPotassium] abierta hacia el exterior
   [openToOutsidePotassiumBound] abierta hacia el exterior

   [openToOutsideAwaitingParticles] abierta hacia el exterior 
   [openToOutsideAllParticlesBound] abierta hacia el exterior
   [openToInside] abierta hacia el interior

   [closedNegative70mV] cerrada
   [openNegative50mV] abierta 
   [closed30mV] cerrada

   [closedNegative50mV] cerrada
   [open30mV] abierta

   [ligandBoundClosed] cerrada
   [ligandBoundOpen] abierta
   [ligandUnboundOpen] abierta
   [closed] cerrada

   *[open] abierta 
}

a11y.transportProtein.accessibleParagrap.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] A la espera de sodio, abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumBound] 3 sodios unidos, esperando fosfato, abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] El ATP reacciona, fosfato unido, bombeando 3 sodios al exterior, abierta hacia el interior
   [openToInsideSodiumAndPhosphateBound] Fosfato unido, bombeando 3 sodios al exterior, abierta hacia el interior
   [openToOutsideAwaitingPotassium] A la espera de potasio, fosfato unido, abierta hacia el exterior
   [openToOutsidePotassiumBound] El fosfato se aleja flotando, bombeando 2 potasios al interior, abierta hacia el exterior

   [openToOutsideAwaitingParticles] { $warning ->
     [shown] Advertencia, sodio exterior demasiado bajo para unión, abierta hacia el exterior
     *[hidden] A la espera de sodio y glucosa, abierta hacia el exterior
   }
   [openToOutsideAllParticlesBound] Sodio y glucosa unidos, abierta hacia el exterior
   [openToInside] Bombeando sodio y glucosa al interior, abierta hacia el interior

   [ligandBoundClosed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Unión de ligando triángulo, canal abriéndose
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Unión de ligando estrella, canal abriéndose
   }
   [ligandBoundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Canal abierto con ligando triángulo unido
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Canal abierto con ligando estrella unido
   }
   [ligandUnboundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] El ligando triángulo se aleja flotando, el canal se cierra 
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] El ligando estrella se aleja flotando, el canal se cierra
   }
   [closed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Canal cerrado sin ligando triángulo unido
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Canal cerrado sin ligando estrella unido
   }

   [closedNegative70mV] Canal cerrado a -70 mV
   [openNegative50mV] Canal abierto a -50 mV
   [closed30mV] Canal cerrado a 30 mV

   [closedNegative50mV] Canal cerrado a -50 mV
   [open30mV] Canal abierto a 30 mV

   *[open] Canal abierto
}.

a11y.transportProtein.accessibleContextR.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] El fosfato se aleja flotando, bombeando 2 potasios al interior
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] El ATP reacciona, se une fosfato, bombeando 3 sodios al exterior

   *[openToInside] { $glucoseBehavior ->
     [metabolized] Transporta 2 sodios y 1 glucosa al interior; la glucosa transportada se metaboliza
     *[persistent] Transporta 2 sodios y 1 glucosa al interior
   }

   [ligandBoundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Se une ligando triángulo, abierta
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Se une ligando estrella, abierta
   }
   [closed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] El ligando triángulo se aleja flotando, cerrada
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] El ligando estrella se aleja flotando, cerrada
   }
}.

a11y.transportProtein.briefName.value:
{ $type ->
  [sodiumIonLeakageChannel]         Selectiva para sodio, de fuga
  [potassiumIonLeakageChannel]      Selectiva para potasio, de fuga
  [sodiumIonVoltageGatedChannel]    Selectiva para sodio, regulada por voltaje
  [potassiumIonVoltageGatedChannel] Selectiva para potasio, regulada por voltaje
  [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel]     Selectiva para sodio, regulada por ligando
  [potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel]  Selectiva para potasio, regulada por ligando
  [sodiumPotassiumPump]             Bomba sodio-potasio
 *[sodiumGlucoseCotransporter]      Cotransportador sodio-glucosa
}

a11y.membranePotential.sodiumVoltageGate.value: Selectiva para sodio, regulada por voltaje, abierta.
Selectiva para sodio, regulada por voltaje, cerrada.

a11y.membranePotential.potassiumVoltageG.value: Selectiva para potasio, regulada por voltaje, abierta.
Selectiva para potasio, regulada por voltaje, cerrada.

a11y.membranePotential.noChangeResponse.value: Sin cambios en las proteínas de transporte.

Ajusta en cantidades más pequeñas con Mayús más Flecha izquierda y derecha o Mayús más A y D.

a11y.keyboardHelp.transportProteinsAndLi.value: Navega por proteínas en la caja de herramientas o ligandos añadidos con la tecla Tab.

a11y.keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.n.value: Navega por proteínas en la membrana con Flecha izquierda y derecha o con A y D.

a11y.keyboardHelp.sortOrDeleteProteins.g.value: Toma la proteína en la membrana con la barra espaciadora o Enter.

{ a11y_solutes_briefName } cruzando { $direction ->
  [inward] hacia adentro
 *[outward] hacia afuera

a11y.membraneTransportDescriber.hints.li.value: Proteína regulada por ligando cerrada. Busca ligandos

a11y.membraneTransportDescriber.hints.vo.value: Proteína regulada por voltaje cerrada. Revisa el potencial de membrana

a11y.membraneTransportDescriber.hints.pu.value: La bomba necesita una fuente de fosfato

a11y.membraneTransportDescriber.hints.so.value: El cotransportador no une sodio. Sodio exterior demasiado bajo

description.value: Wiggling animation of phospholipid bilayer forming the cell membrane.
Glucose molecules fade away inside cell to simulate conversion for cellular metabolism.
Emphasize solute transport direction by mapping sound to right (outside to inside) and left (inside to outside) channels.

navigate.value: Navigate proteins in toolbox or added ligands

moveGrabbedItem.value: Move grabbed protein or ligand between available drop locations

title.value: Sort or Delete Proteins in Membrane

releaseProtein.value: Release grabbed protein into empty slot or swap slots

screenButtonsHelpText.value: Explore what solutes can diffuse freely in a cellular environment.
Explore conditions to facilitate diffusion for solutes using transport proteins.
Explore conditions to actively transport solutes using transport proteins.
Play with all solutes and all transport proteins.

intro.value:
An observation window zooms in on a very small cross-section of a cell's membrane.
  The membrane consists of a wiggling phospholipid bilayer, a double-layered sheet
  that separates fluids inside and outside of cell. When added to outside or inside,
  solute particles are suspended in fluid and randomly move with Brownian motion.

proteins.value: Transport proteins of different types can be added directly to membrane.

potential.value: There are options to change cell environment and affect added proteins.

barCharts.value: Bar charts of solute concentrations dynamically compare solute amounts outside and inside cell.

controlArea.value: You can pause action or slow it down to hear more details, add or remove sounds and highlights that enhance solute crossings, and you can reset everything to start over.

leadingParagraph.value: Right now, zoomed-in cross section of cell has:

soluteTypesOnOutside.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } solute type on outside
 *[other] { $count } solute types on outside
}

soluteTypesOnInside.value:
{ $count ->
  [one] { $count } solute type on inside
 *[other] { $count } solute types on inside
}

transportProteins.value:
{ $proteinCount ->
  [one] { $proteinCount} protein
  *[other] { $proteinCount} proteins
} of { $proteinTypeCount ->
  [one] { $proteinTypeCount } type
 *[other] { $proteinTypeCount} types
}, in membrane

ligands.value: 2 added ligand types on outside only

atpReacting.value: ATP reacting to form ADP and phosphate, which regularly fade away on the inside

glucoseMetabolism.value: Glucose disappears from inside as it is metabolized by the cell

interactionHint.value: Add or remove solute to outside or inside of cell and observe solute concentrations.

interactionHintWithTransportProteins.value: Add or remove solutes to outside or inside of cell, move transport proteins to membrane, and observe solute concentrations.

accessibleHelpText.value: Add or remove chosen solute to outside or inside of cell.

accessibleContextResponse.value: Solutes cleared. Add solutes to observe changes.

accessibleHelpText.value: Disabled when no solutes have been added.
Explore with or without visual highlights for solute crossings.

accessibleContextResponseChecked.value: Visual highlights for solute crossings, on.

accessibleContextResponseUnchecked.value: Visual highlights for solute crossings, off.

accessibleHelpText.value: Explore with or without unique sounds for solute crossings.
Look for proteins to grab. Once grabbed, use keyboard shortcuts to release in a membrane slot. Grab again from membrane to sort or delete.
Transmembrane single channel proteins that can be open or closed. When closed has a triangle- or star-shaped ligand binding site.
Transmembrane single channel proteins, always open.
Transmembrane single channel proteins that can be open or closed.
Explore with or without charge signs showing membrane potential along inside and outside.

voicingHelpText.value: Explore with or without charge signs along membrane.

accessibleContextResponseCheckedNegative.value: Positive outside and negative inside; charge signs densely packed along membrane.
Positive outside and negative inside; charge signs lightly packed along membrane.

accessibleContextResponseCheckedPositive.value: Negative outside and positive inside; charge signs sparse along membrane.

accessibleHelpText.value:
Proteins that open to one side at a time. Sodium Potassium Pump, when open to inside has binding sites for 3 
  sodium and 1 phosphate. When open to outside has binding sites for 2 potassium. Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter, 
  only open to outside and has binding sites for 2 sodium and 1 glucose. Requires higher outside sodium concentration to shuttle.
Grab a ligand. Once grabbed, use keyboard shortcuts to move ligand to binding site. Release to bind or let ligands bind naturally.

releasedOnBusyOrIncompatibleProteinRespo.value: Released. Binding unsuccessful. Ligand floats away.

movedAboveLigandGatedChannelResponse.value:
Above { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   open
*[closed] closed
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName } { $proteinType ->
[sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Triangle Site
*[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel]     Star Site
}, { $index } of { $transportProteinCount } Proteins.

movedAboveOtherChannelResponse.value:
Above { $openOrClosed ->
[open]   open
*[closed] closed
} { a11y_transportProtein_briefName }, { $index } of { $transportProteinCount } Proteins.

grabbedResponse.value: Grabbed. Off membrane. { $proteinCount } Proteins in Membrane.

grabbedResponseWithHint.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Move ligand with A or D keys. Space to release.

grabbedResponseWithEmptyMembraneHint.value: { a11y_ligandNode_grabbedResponse } Space to release. Add transport proteins.

lowercaseName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        oxygen molecules
  [carbonDioxide] carbon dioxide molecules
  [sodiumIon]     sodium ions
  [potassiumIon]  potassium ions
  [glucose]       glucose molecules
 *[atp]           ATP molecules
}

uppercaseName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        Oxygen Molecules
  [carbonDioxide] Carbon Dioxide molecules
  [sodiumIon]     Sodium Ions
  [potassiumIon]  Potassium Ions
  [glucose]       Glucose Molecules
 *[atp]           ATP Molecules
}

briefName.value:
{ $soluteType ->
  [oxygen]        Oxygen
  [carbonDioxide] Carbon Dioxide
  [sodiumIon]     Sodium
  [potassiumIon]  Potassium
  [glucose]       Glucose
 *[atp]           ATP
}

amountComparison.value:
{ $amount ->
  *[none]  none
  [equal] amounts exactly equal outside and inside
  [allOutside] all outside, none inside
  [allInside] all inside, none outside
  [manyManyMoreOutside] way more outside than inside
  [manyMoreOutside] many more outside than inside
  [aboutTwiceAsManyOutside] about twice as many outside as inside
  [aLotMoreOutside] a lot more outside than inside
  [someMoreOutside] some more outside than inside
  [littleBitMoreOutside] a little bit more outside than inside
  [roughlyEqualOutside] roughly equal amounts inside and outside
  [manyManyMoreInside] way more inside than outside
  [manyMoreInside] many more inside than outside
  [aboutTwiceAsManyInside] about twice as many inside as outside
  [aLotMoreInside] a lot more inside than outside
  [someMoreInside] some more inside than outside
  [littleBitMoreInside] a little bit more inside than outside
  [roughlyEqualInside] roughly equal amounts inside and outside
}

averageCrossingDirection.value:
{ $direction ->
  [toOutside] to outside
  [mostlyToOutside] mostly to outside
  [inBothDirections] in both directions
  [mostlyToInside] mostly to inside
  [toInside] to inside
  *[none] none recently
}

accessibleHelpText.value: Choose a solute for the Solute Adjusters.
Adjust chosen solute amount on outside with Arrow keys or alternate keyboard shortcuts.
Adjust chosen solute amount on inside with Arrow keys or alternate keyboard shortcuts.

voicingHintResponse.value: Adjust chosen solute with Arrow keys or Arrow buttons.

accessibleHelpTextAllDisabled.value: Disabled, total chosen solute at max amount.

accessibleObjectResponse.value:
{ $amount ->
  [none] no
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount of
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount of
  [hugeAmount] huge amount of
 *[maxAmount] max amount of
} { a11y_solutes_lowercaseName }

accessibleContextResponse.value:
{ $addedOrRemoved ->
  [addedToMax] {$delta} added, solute at max
  [removedToMin] Removed
  [added]  {$delta} added
 *[removed] {$delta} removed
}. Now, { a11y_solutes_amountComparison }.

descriptionContent.value: Dynamic bar charts show concentration comparisons and recent crossings for each solute. If needed, pause sim to read details.

accessibleContextResponseExpanded.value: Dynamic bar charts show solute details.

voicingHintResponseCollapsed.value: Expand to show dynamic bar charts with solute details.

accessibleNameWithParticles.value:
{ a11y_solutes_uppercaseName }: { a11y_solutes_amountComparison }; crossings { a11y_solutes_averageCrossingDirection }; { $outsideAmount ->
  [none] none
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount
  [hugeAmount] huge amount
 *[maxAmount] max amount
} outside, { $insideAmount ->
  [none] none
  [few] a few
  [some] some
  [smallAmount] small amount
  [several] several
  [many] many
  [largeAmount] large amount
  [hugeAmount] huge amount
 *[maxAmount] max amount
} inside.

glucoseMetabolism.value: Glucose disappears from inside as it is metabolized by cell.

leadingParagraph.value: Zoomed-in cross section of cell has:

noSolutes.value: Look to adjust solute types and amounts.

withSolutes.value: Observe crossing solutes. Look to adjust solute types and amounts.

withSolutes.value: Observe crossing solutes. Look to adjust solutes and proteins.

noSolutes.value: Look to adjust solutes and proteins.

withSolutes.value: Observe crossing solutes and protein changes. Look to adjust solutes and proteins.

initialGrabbedHintResponse.value: Choose slot with A or D keys. Space to release. Delete to remove.

accessibleObjectResponse.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumBound] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndPhosphateBound] open to inside
   [openToOutsideAwaitingPotassium] open to outside
   [openToOutsidePotassiumBound] open to outside

   [openToOutsideAwaitingParticles] open to outside 
   [openToOutsideAllParticlesBound] open to outside
   [openToInside] open to inside

   [closedNegative70mV] closed
   [openNegative50mV] open 
   [closed30mV] closed

   [closedNegative50mV] closed
   [open30mV] open

   [ligandBoundClosed] closed
   [ligandBoundOpen] open
   [ligandUnboundOpen] open
   [closed] closed

   *[open] open 
}

accessibleParagraph.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] Awaiting sodium, open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumBound] 3 sodium bound, awaiting phosphate, open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] ATP reacts, phosphate bound, pumping 3 sodium to outside, open to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndPhosphateBound] Phosphate bound, pumping 3 sodium to outside, open to inside
   [openToOutsideAwaitingPotassium] Awaiting potassium, phosphate bound, open to outside
   [openToOutsidePotassiumBound] Phosphate floating away, pumping 2 potassium to inside, open to outside

   [openToOutsideAwaitingParticles] { $warning ->
     [shown] Warning, outside sodium too low for binding, open to outside
     *[hidden] Awaiting sodium and glucose, open to outside
   }
   [openToOutsideAllParticlesBound] Sodium and glucose bound, open to outside
   [openToInside] Pumping sodium and glucose to inside, open to inside

   [ligandBoundClosed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Triangle ligand binding, channel opening
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Star ligand binding, channel opening
   }
   [ligandBoundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Channel open with bound triangle ligand
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Channel open with bound star ligand
   }
   [ligandUnboundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Triangle ligand floats away, channel closing 
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Star ligand floats away, channel closing
   }
   [closed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Channel closed with no bound triangle ligand
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Channel closed with no bound star ligand
   }

   [closedNegative70mV] Channel closed at -70 mV
   [openNegative50mV] Channel open at -50 mV
   [closed30mV] Channel closed at 30 mV

   [closedNegative50mV] Channel closed at -50 mV
   [open30mV] Channel open at 30 mV

   *[open] Channel open
}.

accessibleContextResponse.value:
{ $state ->
   [openToInsideEmpty] Phosphate floats away, pumping 2 potassium to inside
   [openToInsideSodiumAndATPBound] ATP reacts, phosphate binds, pumping 3 sodium to outside

   *[openToInside] { $glucoseBehavior ->
     [metabolized] Shuttles 2 sodium, one glucose inside, shuttled glucose metabolized
     *[persistent] Shuttles 2 sodium, one glucose inside
   }

   [ligandBoundOpen] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Triangle ligand binds, open
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Star ligand binds, open
   }
   [closed] { $proteinType ->
     [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Triangle ligand floats away, closed
     *[potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel] Star ligand floats away, closed
   }
}.

briefName.value:
{ $type ->
  [sodiumIonLeakageChannel]         Sodium-selective, Leakage
  [potassiumIonLeakageChannel]      Potassium-selective, Leakage
  [sodiumIonVoltageGatedChannel]    Sodium-selective, Voltage-Gated
  [potassiumIonVoltageGatedChannel] Potassium-selective, Voltage-Gated
  [sodiumIonLigandGatedChannel]     Sodium-selective, Ligand-Gated
  [potassiumIonLigandGatedChannel]  Potassium-selective, Ligand-Gated
  [sodiumPotassiumPump]             Sodium Potassium Pump
 *[sodiumGlucoseCotransporter]      Sodium-Glucose Cotransporter
}

addOrRemoveALotDescription.value: Adjust chosen solute amount with Left and Right Arrow keys or A and D letter keys.

addOrRemoveALittleDescription.value: Adjust in smaller amounts with Shift plus Left and Right Arrow keys or Shift plus A and D letter keys.

navigateDescription.value: Navigate proteins in toolbox or added ligands with Tab key.

grabOrReleaseDescription.value: Grab or release with Space or Enter keys.

moveGrabbedItemDescription.value: Move grabbed protein or ligand between available drop locations with Left and Right Arrow keys or A and D letter keys.

cancelGrabDescription.value: Cancel grab or move interaction with Escape key.

navigateProteinsDescription.value: Navigate proteins in membrane with Left and Right Arrow keys or A and D letter keys.

grabProteinDescription.value: Grab protein in membrane with Space or Enter keys.

moveGrabbedProteinDescription.value: Move grabbed protein between slots with Left and Right Arrow keys or A and D letter keys.

releaseProteinDescription.value: Release grabbed protein into empty slot or swap slots with Space or Enter keys.

deleteProteinDescription.value: Delete grabbed protein with Backspace or Delete key.

ligandGatedChannelWithoutLigands.value: Ligand-gated protein closed. Look for ligands

voltageGatedChannelAtRestingPotential.value: Voltage-gated protein closed. Check membrane potential

sodiumGlucoseCotransporterWithLowOutside.value: Cotransporter not binding sodium. Outside sodium too low

crossingSteadilyInBothDirections.value: { a11y_solutes_briefName } crossing steadily in both directions, each side roughly equal

sodiumPumpedOutsideAndPotassiumPumpedIns.value: sodium pumped outside and potassium pumped inside
